greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to factor n into factors > 1 all having the same sum of prime indices.
comment: Also the number of multiset partitions of the multiset of prime indices of n with equal block-sums.
A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798. The sum of prime indices of n is A056239(n).
link: Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and ranking multiset partitions whose part lengths, sums, or averages are constant or strict.
example: The a(1440) = 6 factorizations into factors all having the same sum of prime indices:
The a(900) = 5 multiset partitions with equal block-sums:
xref: Positions of 1's are A321453. Positions of terms > 1 are A321454.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 10 2018
